result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyreace R Mills was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court imposed applicable fees, assessments, restitution, Court costs, surcharges including DNA assessment.  DOC to cllect at the rate of maximum 25% of any amounts provided in Secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts remaining unpaid when defendant is released from confinement to be paid as a  condition of Extended Supervision.  Any unpaid amount ordered reduced to a judgment against defendant and then can proceed under Sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
-You may have to give a swab which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.

superMiscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety.   Random urine screens.
Comply with sex offender requirements.
Undergo counseling and any drug treatment deemed necessary by the DOC.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
$30.00 payable to the Crime Victim Compensation Program.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyreace R Mills

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: /DENYING Motion For Production of Transcripts.  Order signed and filed.
per order dated September 8, 2017, Appeal No. 2017XX1133CR, the motion for reconsideration is denied.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, calendar successor, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se motion for production of transcripts.  (Return Address:  Tyreace Mills #639624, Fox Lake Correctional Institution, P.O. Box 200, Fox Lake, WI  53933).
per order dated August 22, 2017, Appeal No. 2017XX1133CR, Mills's motion to extend the deadline for filing a notice of intent to pursue postconviction relief in this matter is denied.
Letter to Court of Appeals submitting a copy of the Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, per Court of Appeals Order dated August 9, 2017.

per order dated August 9, 2017, Appeal No. 2017XX1133-CR, IT IS ORDERED that no later than August 21, 2017, the clerk of circuit court shall transmit to the clerk of this court the Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief described above.  If the document is not available, the clerk shall be that same deadline so notify the court.
Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (32 pages) commencing 01/29/16 received and filed.
Original INTERVIEW Transcript (38 pages) received and filed.

Defendant Tyreace R Mills in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Tyreace R Mills in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Presentence report reviewed.  Statements made as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 15 YEARS, with credit for 312 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 10 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Court rejects probation recommendation.
Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
Defendant to maintain employment.
NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS.
The defendant is to comply with sex offender requirements.
Defendant to undergo counseling and any drug treatment deemed necessary by the DOC.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. Court orders restitution (surcharges applicable) in the amount of $30 payable to the Crime Victim Compensation Program. 
The Court is imposing the applicable fees, assessments,  restitution, court costs, and surcharges, including a DNA assessment.  You may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.  The Court orders the DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of the extended supervision.  Any monetary mounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
received and filed from the Crime Victim Compensation Program.
Defense counsel has not received the results from a psycological exam conducted based on the PSI. Parties stipulate to an adjournment.

Defendant Tyreace R Mills in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Tyreace R Mills in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Defense counsel would like to have the defendant undergo a psychological evaulation based on the PSI. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 7.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Request for payment of $17  witness fees for witness Javontae M. (Staci M.) processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26212609 in court 1x on 9/1/15.
Request for payment of $17  witness fees for witness Staci M. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26212608 in court 1x on 9/1/15.
Request for payment of$17 witness fees for witness Anyssa M.(Staci M) processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26212607 in court 1x on 9/1/15.
The defendant's telephone, visitation and U.S. Mail privileges are reinstated with the condition that he complies with the NO CONTACT ORDER.
On motion of the State, Court ordered count 1 amended to Second Degree Sexual Assault of a Child (CONTACT), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.02(2), 939.50(3)(c) a Felony.

Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Sworn for the state:  MPD Detective Steve Wells. Exhibit  3, 2, 11, 4  received.  

Defendant wants to enter a plea. State withdraws all exhibits.
On State's motion, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN.
AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI was ordered.

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:37 pm.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.

Defendant Tyreace R Mills in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Tyreace R Mills in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called and passed until 1:30 pm.
State's Consolidated Witness List.

Defendant Tyreace R Mills in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Tyreace R Mills in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Defense counsel is no longer challenging the defendant's statements and will not proceed with the motion to suppress. No pending issues remain. Defense to file a witness list with any additional witnesses by 7/24/15. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 8/31/15. Parties advised as of August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams,  Branch 07, Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Tyreace R Mills in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Tyreace R Mills in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams on behalf of Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Motion hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 7/10/15 and for jury trial on 8/31/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Attorney Bowe contacted the Court and advised the Court she is out of town and unable to appear in court today. State notified. Court ordered an additional status of counsel date be set. Case remains scheduled for a final pretrial on 7/10/15 and for jury trial on 8/31/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Further proceedings scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case set for motion hearing. Court entered the speedy trial demand as of 6/05/15. Defense counsel previously filed a motion to withdraw as counsel. Court granted defense counsel's request and allowed attorney Andriusis to withdraw as counsel of record. Due to judicial rotation, Court ordered the jury trial date of 8/03/15 be vacated. Case remains scheduled for final pretrial on 7/10/15. Parties advised as of 8/01/15 this case will be assigned to Judge McAdams in Branch 07, Room 620 of the Safety Building. Order signed and filed. Copies of the order given the the Sheriff's Department. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Tyreace R Mills in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Defendant Tyreace R Mills in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Julius Andriusis in court, defendant Tyreace R Mills not in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests final pretrial and jury trial dates. Defense counsel intends to file  Miranda/Goodchild motion. Parties to file motions by 5/06/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defense counsel contacted the court requesting this matter be heard at 1:30 p.m. instead of 8:30 a.m. State notified and does not object. Case adjourned to 4/22/15 at 1:30 p.m. for Scheduling Conference in Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Filed and Signed, Court Order Rescinding Defendant's Telephone, Visitation, and U.S. Mail Custody Privileges.
Court orders other terms and conditions of bail to remain the same.
Bail motion by the state argued and granted by the Court.  Bail is AMENDED to $20,000.00 CASH.

Defendant Tyreace R Mills in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Defendant Tyreace R Mills in custody.  Erin Karshen for Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Gary Brown-MPD Officer.  Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling Conference on April 22, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.  in Branch 25.

Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for preliminary hearing. State is requesting adjournment.  Defense requesting bail hearing on next court date. Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.M.M, S.MD, or their family.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tyreace R Mills in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Tyreace R Mills in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
